header_summary:
Recent discussions across various platforms have highlighted the critical need for enhancing the resilience of Bitcoin against major solar events, a concern sparked by the potential for catastrophic disruptions similar to the Carrington Event of 1859. Proposals include improving Bitcoin Core to support degraded communication channels and documenting best practices for network operations during extreme conditions to mitigate the risks of chain splits and network fragmentation ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/d9f4f899-14d1-4787-8046-acd59ff1ba98n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m754b81006bb283fa2f1da550567e90cd57ee11f3)). 

In the realm of blockchain development, there's an ongoing debate on the complexity of Bitcoin's scripting language, particularly the transition to tarscript (V2) and its implications for block assembly. This discussion contrasts the complexity introduced by tarscript with the simplicity of another language, Simplicity, highlighting the dilemma between enhancing functionality and maintaining a computationally manageable system ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAMZUoK=1B=LQxkhPsbx22wAFkgsKT20J-6+r-Pa0AAh9AMgo4g@mail.gmail.com/T/#md729a0aee56f6e493967b384f1ba6bb154df8482)).

A detailed exploration into the prevention of DDoS attacks within the Bitcoin network underscores the delicate balance required to mitigate one attack vector without facilitating another. This analysis delves into the dynamics between prevout lookups and quadratic hashing exploits, emphasizing the complexity of securing the network against such adversarial tactics through nuanced adjustments in policy checks and signature operations limits ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/V0qeILOW1CuH3NS2O8IUdQBK8i3o8LwzLNGf7xh1UO0S_Gzui1CpdP5NhdT3EtrW6NgqxJ538egeag6bVZoBX8C8E46ZYTCyPg1qBxkwCXs=@protonmail.com/T/#me9a87652ba546191d2309dde8a669fdc98dce0a2)).

Furthermore, discussions around the advantages of the Cairo architecture over RISC-V for implementing zk-STARKs in zkVMs bring to light the ongoing advancements in cryptographic technology. This comparison points to Cairo's technical superiority for certain blockchain applications, especially those requiring security and efficiency in executing zero-knowledge proofs, underscoring the critical nature of architectural choices in the development of privacy-preserving protocols and decentralized finance ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/proposal-op-stark-verify-native-stark-proof-verification-in-bitcoin-script/2056/11)).

recent_posts.title: Improve Bitcoin’s resilience to large-scale power grid failures and Carrington-type solar storms
recent_posts.summary:
- The feature request aims to enhance Bitcoin's resilience against disruptions from major solar events.
- Proposed improvements focus on degraded communication support and operator guidance for Bitcoin Core.
- Discussion revolves around whether to pursue these enhancements within Bitcoin Core or through external projects.

recent_posts.title: Benchmarking Bitcoin Script Evaluation for the Varops Budget (GSR)
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on the complexity Bitcoin's new script versions introduce to block assembly.
- Simplicity offers a contrast with its unified budget for cost calculations, unlike tarscript V2.
- The debate highlights the balance between adding functionality and maintaining computational simplicity in blockchain development.

recent_posts.title: BIP54 implementation and test vectors
recent_posts.summary:
- The analysis discusses DDoS attack prevention on the Bitcoin network, emphasizing a balance in security measures.
- A 2500 sigops limit is proposed to mitigate quadratic hashing risks without aiding other attack forms.
- It highlights the importance of cost-benefit analysis for attackers and suggests continuous scrutiny of defense strategies.
contributors: BIP54 implementation and test vectors 'Antoine Poinsot'

recent_posts.title: Could Bitcoin Mining Survive a Carrington-Level Solar Storm?
recent_posts.summary:
- Solar storms threaten global technological infrastructure, including telecommunication and electrical grids.
- A Carrington-scale solar storm could drastically reduce Bitcoin's mining power, disrupting transaction processing.
- The resilience of Bitcoin's infrastructure against such storms is crucial for its continuity and survival.

recent_posts.title: Proposal: OP_STARK_VERIFY - Native STARK Proof Verification in Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- Cairo's technical advantages make it preferable for zk-STARKs over RISC-V architecture.
- Discussions in the zcash forum address Cairo STARKs' adoption for blockchain technologies.
- The comparison highlights the importance of selecting suitable frameworks for cryptographic advancements.

recent_posts.title: Gossip Observer: New project to monitor the Lightning P2P network
recent_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network may shift from a message flooding protocol to a more efficient design.
- Adaptation of Minisketch for LN gossip could reduce reconciliation time with unique salts.
- Proposed gossip 1.5 format aims to enhance efficiency by tailoring message fields and reducing bandwidth.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Reduced Data Temporary Softfork
authors: [BIP Proposal] Reduced Data Temporary Softfork dathonohm
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal seeks to limit Bitcoin Core v30 data at the consensus level temporarily.
- It introduces a soft fork with proactive and reactive activation methods for one year.
- Community feedback and technical contributions toward activation and testing are encouraged.

active_posts.title: Motion to Activate BIP 3
active_posts.summary:
- BIP 3 was moved to "Proposed" status in March 2025, after completion of work in February.
- Significant changes to BIP 3 include adoption of SPDX License Expressions and clarity enhancements.
- A broad community support for BIP 3 is evident, with active discussions and endorsements on Github.

active_posts.title: OP_CHECKUTXOSETHASH idea
active_posts.summary:
- Erik Aronesty proposes adding `OP_CHECKUTXOSETHASH` to enhance Bitcoin's efficiency.
- The proposal allows optional embedding of UTXO set hashes in blocks for verification.
- This mechanism aims to reduce resource demands on nodes while preserving blockchain integrity.

active_posts.title: BIP352: PSBT support
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion addresses enhancing PSBTs for privacy and security in crypto transactions.
- It describes a viable method for spending through `PSBT_IN_PROPRIETARY` with a `shared_secret_tweak`.
- A draft BIP proposes an `OutputGenerator` role for integrating silent payment logic efficiently.

active_posts.title: P2share: how to turn any network (or testnet!) into a bitcoin miner
active_posts.summary:
- The p2share network introduces a unique bitcoin mining reward distribution system via shares.
- Rewards are randomly allocated to one shareholder, promoting fairness and minimizing transaction bloat.
- It aims to enhance decentralization and efficiency in Bitcoin mining, stirring potential impacts on blockchain evolution.

active_posts.title: Taxonomy of Transaction Fees in Smart Contracts
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets and smart contracts in Bitcoin use various fee mechanisms affecting mempool design.
- Endogenous and exogenous fees enable different transaction strategies within and outside smart contracts.
- Techniques like CPFP and package RBF address transaction fees and complexities in smart contract applications.

today_in_history_posts.title: OP_CHECKWILDCARDSIGVERIFY or "Wildcard Inputs" or "Coalescing Transactions"
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Chris Priest proposes an opcode, OP_CHECKWILDCARDSIGVERIFY, to reduce transaction fees.
- The proposed solution coalesces multiple UTXOs into a single output, lowering fees.
- This approach, needing refinement, aims to address the issue of small UTXOs.

today_in_history_posts.title: Lightning, the death of BIP62, and Segregated Witness
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The author identified anchor malleability as an issue in his lightning variant.
- Rusty Russell chose to assume Segregated Witness would address malleability concerns.
- This decision aligns with Bitcoin's and smart contracts' best interests, despite future challenges.

today_in_history_posts.title: Differential Fuzzing of Bitcoin implementations
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The project focuses on differential fuzzing for Bitcoin, especially miniscript parts.
- It seeks community feedback to improve fuzzing strategies, accessible on GitHub.
- Contributions aim to bolster Bitcoin technology's security and reliability.
